Package com.pranab.playwithgraphs.weightedgraphs.directed

Interface DirectedWeightedGraph<V,​K,​W extends Weight>

Type Parameters:
V - The relational entity type, that will be used as vertex in vertex-edge mapping ,
K - Unique key to identify a Vertex
W - An entity that implements Weight so as to simulate strength of relationship as integer values.
All Superinterfaces:
Graph<V,​K>, WeightedGraph<V,​K,​W>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjacencyListDirectedWeightedGraph
public interface DirectedWeightedGraph<V,​K,​W extends Weight>
extends WeightedGraph<V,​K,​W>
The Interface abstracts out the methods for weighed graph.
Author:
Pranab Bharadwaj

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkCycle()
    Checks weather there is a cycle in the provided graph.
    Example : A -< B -< C -< A contains a cycle
    java.util.List<java.util.List<K>> getStrongConnectedComponent()
    Identifies all the strongly connected components in a given graph.
    java.util.List<K> getTopologicalOrdered()
    does a topologically sorting of given graph.
    A topological sort or topological ordering of a directed graph is a linear ordering of its vertices such that for every directed edge uv from vertex u to vertex v, u comes before v in the ordering
    java.util.List<V> searchLevel​(K startingKeyPoint, int searchLevel, boolean includeBeforeLevel)
    provides a level wise search from the source node provided.
    Level 1 - returns all the nodes directly linked with source node.
    Level 2 - returns all the nodes directly linked to the nodes returned in Level 1.
    java.util.Queue<K> searchSortestPath​(K startingKeyPoint, K targetKeyPoint)
    finds the shortest path between two given Nodes/Vertex

    Methods inherited from interface com.pranab.playwithgraphs.Graph

    createNode, getAllEdgeKeys, getValue, removeAllEdges, removeEdge, removeEdges, removeNode, resetAllNodes, size, updateNode

    Methods inherited from interface com.pranab.playwithgraphs.weightedgraphs.WeightedGraph

    createEdge, createEdges, updateEdgeWeight

  • Method Details

    • searchLevel

      java.util.List<V> searchLevel​(K startingKeyPoint, int searchLevel, boolean includeBeforeLevel)
      provides a level wise search from the source node provided.
      Level 1 - returns all the nodes directly linked with source node.
      Level 2 - returns all the nodes directly linked to the nodes returned in Level 1.
      Parameters:
      startingKeyPoint - - the node which acts as the source node or the starting point of search
      searchLevel - - integer value emphasizing the level from the source node which needs to be searched.
      includeBeforeLevel - - boolean value when true includes the previous level nodes in the result
      Returns:
      a list of keys of the Vertices present in that level Or the list of keys till that level depending on includeBeforeLevel variable value

    • searchSortestPath

      java.util.Queue<K> searchSortestPath​(K startingKeyPoint, K targetKeyPoint)
      finds the shortest path between two given Nodes/Vertex
      Parameters:
      startingKeyPoint - - the node which acts as the source node or the starting point
      targetKeyPoint - - the target node to which the path needs to be identified
      Returns:
      list of all the nodes that make up the path to the targeted node.

    • checkCycle

      boolean checkCycle()
      Checks weather there is a cycle in the provided graph.
      Example : A -< B -< C -< A contains a cycle
      Returns:
      boolean value when true,the graph contains a cycle

    • getTopologicalOrdered

      java.util.List<K> getTopologicalOrdered()
      does a topologically sorting of given graph.
      A topological sort or topological ordering of a directed graph is a linear ordering of its vertices such that for every directed edge uv from vertex u to vertex v, u comes before v in the ordering
      Returns:
      list of Nodes/Vertex keys, topologically sorted

    • getStrongConnectedComponent

      java.util.List<java.util.List<K>> getStrongConnectedComponent()
      Identifies all the strongly connected components in a given graph.
      Returns:
      List of strongly connected component nodes list.
